com.cyc.session

Class CycServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.session.ServerAddress
      • com.cyc.session.CycServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CycServerAddress, Serializable, Comparable

    public class CycServer
extends ServerAddress
implements CycServerAddress
    Describes the address of a Cyc server. This class encapsulates a Cyc server's host name, base port, and offset ports. It is easily serializable via its ServerAddress.toString() method to a string representation as host:port, and can be instantiated from strings matching that format via its static #fromString() method.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • isValidString

        public static boolean isValidString(String string)
        Tests whether a String could be deserialized into a valid CycServer. The string must match the format host:port, the host must be a valid hostname or IP address, and the port must be a valid port integer. Any string which is validated by this method should be a well-formed input for #fromString().
        Parameters:
        string - to evaluate
        Returns:
        whether it is a valid serialized CycServer address.

      • fromString

        public static CycServer fromString(String string)
        Creates a new CycServer instance from a string matching the format host:port.
        Parameters:
        string - a string matching the format host:port.
        Returns:
        A new CycServer instance based on the string representation.

      • guessBasePortFromOffsetPort

        public static Integer guessBasePortFromOffsetPort(int port)
        Attempts to guess the base port of a CycServer from an offset port. For example, given a port of 3654, we can somewhat safely guess that the base port would be 3640.

        Be very careful with this method. It is only a guess, and this method can (and has!) been wrong before. There's no guarantee that a Cyc server will be running in the 3600 block; if a Cyc server is running at, e.g., 3780 (which is rare, but entirely possible), and this method is given '80', it will incorrectly guess that the base port is 3680. In short, any time you use this method, make sure that any potential errors are visible to users, and can reasonably be corrected by them.

        Parameters:
        port -
        Returns:
        the base port number
